block.p: Kim Dorie Phillips, the daughter of Gala Cohen of Fisher Island, Fla., and the late Lee Phillips, was married last evening to Robert Roy Baron Jr., the son of Susan Baron of Penn Valley, Pa., and Robert Baron of Millville, N.J. Rabbi William Kuhn officiated at the Metropolitan Club in New York.

Mrs. Baron, 28, is a candidate for a Ph.D. in clinical psychology at Allegheny University of the Health Sciences in Philadelphia. She graduated from Lehigh University. Her father was a vice president at E. F. Hutton, the stock brokerage company that was in New York. Her mother owned Galasthenics, aerobic exercise studios in New York and Bridgehampton, N.Y. The bride's stepfather, Stanley Cohen, was the founder of Playtime Toys in New York.

Mr. Baron, 32, is an associate at Ballard Spahr Andrews & Ingersoll, a Philadelphia law firm. He graduated from Brown University and received a law degree from George Washington University. His mother owns Susan Baron Distinctive Jewelry, a boutique in Philadelphia. His father is the president of Baron & Company, an investment banking concern in Millville, N.J. The bridegroom is the stepson of Valerie Baron.
